Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Brevinin-1RL1 (natural AMPs; frog, amphibians, animals; XXU; 1S=S, UCSS1a)

Literature Information.Literature: APD analysis reveals that the sequence of this peptide most resembles (83.3% similarity)Brevinin-1PLb.Activity: Active against S. aureus ATCC25923 or IS10# or IS37# (MIC 5-10 ug/ml), E. faecalis ATCC29212 (MIC 5 ug/ml), E. coli ATCC25922 or IS37# or IS117# (MIC 1-10 ug/ml),  E. cloacae ATCC13047 (MIC 2.5 and 5), K. pneumoniae ATCC700603 (MIC 2.5 ug/ml), B. dysenteriae (MIC 10 ug/ml), B. pyocyaneus CMCCB1010 (MIC 5 ug/ml), P. aeruginosa ATCC27853 (MIC 10 ug/ml), C. albicans ATCC2002 or ATCC90028 (MIC 5-10 ug/ml), C. parapsilosis ATCC22019 (MIC 20 ug/ml). UPdated 6/2023
Literature Information.Author: Wang Y, Zhang Y, Lee WH, Yang X, Zhang Y.2015
Literature Information.Title: Novel peptides from skins of amphibians showed broad-spectrum antimicrobial activities.
